channel.title: The 4th of July
channel.description:
I will be doing a live web cast of my fireworks starting at around 8pm EST GMT -5 or sooner, until I run out, everyone is welcome and I will not be using tinychat I will be using a better one where I can be the only one broadcasting unless I allow others, for you all that wanna watch post here I will pm you with the link Sunday morning(EST GMT -5), should be fun and I would love it if you all could watch the awesome fireworks I got, and who knows I mite even blow my hand off lol...
Pictures of some of my fireworks coming soon.

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Went to a firework outlet today, picked up some Excalibur and Black Mamba artillery shells/cakes/a bunch of other fountain bags, bottle rockets, roman candles, etc. The bill ended up to be about $300, which will not happen next year lol, but after some bargaining on the expensive artillery shells we got the bill down to $200 ($206 to be exact).

Since no further discussion is wanted in this thread, I guess I’ll lock it.

Read full topic

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:39, topic:347066”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=443443.msg3258519#msg3258519 date=1278307775]

Today there was alot of rain, but after everyone signed out of my chat I started the motars, and all the otehr sky ones, you all miss me burned my hand, almost blowing my foot off, using a romain candle as my penis, ahh it was awesome, I bounced romain candles off the ground xD
[/quote]Do you not know how to spell Roman?

Not when I posted that, and besides I had the red line under it saying I spelled it wrong but I kept it anyways, I don’t see the point to change it, and anyways mite as well lock this.[/quote]Yea.

REQ LOCK.

Read full topic

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Damn, I was playing Xbox and forgot

I’m heading to a fireworks shop tomorrow morning to see if I can get my hands on some cakes without a permit. The person I am going with has done it, so hopefully it’ll happen again. Wish me luck

The weather is being a pain in the ass and I probably won’t even be able to light them off until Thursday, but hopefully it’ll be Wednesday like I have planned for a few days.

Read full topic

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:33, topic:347066”]Well I ruined everyones morning, at 9am I set off about 100firecrackers, then people came out and told us to stop, so we did-.- then about 2hours later at my movie I went and saw I set off even more, 5 big smoke bombs and idk how many colored ones, along with tanks and more firecrackers.

Event starts at 8pm http://tinychat.com/krackkidtv[/quote]Only 100? Last year we did a giant roll of them at once Went on for a few minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:30, topic:347066”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=443443.msg3257287#msg3257287 date=1278214284]
Hmm, yea, I’m doing nothing tomorrow, so I’m in
Although, I could bought $320 worth today while i was down in Ohio, but I don’t feel like going to jail, just to have fun. Michigan firework regulations SUCK ASS!
http://www.fireworks.com/fireworks_laws/laws_michigan.asp
[/quote]

Do you live in town? If you’re in the country, fuck the law :P. Wisconsin has similar laws (E.G. You need a permit to possess and handle fireworks), but I light them off in the middle of the country with like 2 neighbors that could care less.

My dad is going to try and call a few places today to see if we actually have to BRING the permit in and show the counter to purchase Class B fireworks(Cakes, Firecrackers, etc.). Hopefully my dad will only have to show ID to purchase them, because there is no way in hell I am paying $50 for a permit to light off like 65-70 fireworks.[/quote]
Its a small-town, with cops who are power-hungry, and if you give them an inch, they’ll take that inch, and stretch it another mile and a half. Not directly in town, but not far from. Wish I did live in the country though, because my mom (who lives in mississippi), could ship us up some big stuff to launch off. But alas, we are “firework-less” anyways today, so its all good

Read full topic

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:29, topic:347066”]Hmm, yea, I’m doing nothing tomorrow, so I’m in
Although, I could bought $320 worth today while i was down in Ohio, but I don’t feel like going to jail, just to have fun. Michigan firework regulations SUCK ASS!
http://www.fireworks.com/fireworks_laws/laws_michigan.asp[/quote]

Do you live in town? If you’re in the country, fuck the law :P. Wisconsin has similar laws (E.G. You need a permit to possess and handle fireworks), but I light them off in the middle of the country with like 2 neighbors that could care less.

My dad is going to try and call a few places today to see if we actually have to BRING the permit in and show the counter to purchase Class B fireworks(Cakes, Firecrackers, etc.). Hopefully my dad will only have to show ID to purchase them, because there is no way in hell I am paying $50 for a permit to light off like 65-70 fireworks.

[/quote]
Coon seen some of mine last night on cam, but I will get on my laptop later and post a few pictures. or i will go on cam and show you all.[/quote]

item.title: The 4th of July
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:17, topic:347066”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=443443.msg3256606#msg3256606 date=1278165643]

Erm, what’s so special about the 4th of July?
[/quote]America finally beat England in something? it happens once per ~10k years so its VERY special.

Correction, we beat your almighty army with farmers.

Not to mention, an awesome war-plan. SHOOT AND RUN LIKE A BITCH! Yes, I said it, and I’m American, that’s basically all that war-plan was.[/quote]MOTHERFUCKERS

Read full topic

Correction, we beat your almighty army with farmers. ;)[/quote]It cost around $1,000 dollars for the fireworks at my last family part. I could only imagine how much money cities waste on their firework shows. It could be put to better use is all I’m saying. But no, they’re not as interesting as everyone puts them out to be in my opinion.
